FILE: cm437475v11.0.txt
DYAD: IVORY COAST - NIGERIA
RIVALRY: RIV1066
DISPUTE(S): MID4085 

PS-NOTES:

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20190216
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20190216

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID4085

TERRMID: MID4085 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4085 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4085 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4085 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4085 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4085 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4085 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4085 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4085 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4085 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4085 there is no indication in cm narrative, Gibler 2018, or news coverage of this MID that any militarized rebel activity in Ivory Coast is connected to this MID. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4085 1 -- civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4085 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4085 from Gibler 2018, Nigeria bombed the border between Liberia and the Ivory Coast to disperse rebels. The Ivory Coast did not retaliate following an apology. Nigeria bombed the border again three months later, to which the Ivory Coast retaliated with anti-aircraft missiles. Coded civil war link MID because the conflict between the Ivory Coast and Nigeria arose from the Liberian civil war, outside this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID4085 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4085 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4085 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4085 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3 1993-2001:

MID4085
rivalry=437475 nationa=NIGERIA nationb=IVORY COAST MID4085 19930528-19930528 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=USE OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=. fatalpb=. lhostb=
USE OF FORCE 

Nigerian planes bombed a bridge between Cote d'Ivorie and Liberia to prevent support of Liberian rebel group. Jets are part of ECOMOG. Ivory Coast soldiers fired at the Nigerian Plane. Similar incident had happened on 2/27 which was followed by a Nigerian apology for "mistake". First and last day of dispute was on 5/28/1993.

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
